Chinese Traditional (CHT): 既是使他們甚為驚恐，並還令傭人們承認了魔法的存在，成功削弱了反魔法毒素…。

Umineko Project (UP): By doing this, ......she could release herself from the restrictions imposed by the {y:0:Human}{n:0:human}s' toxin.
Steam (ST): The act of unlocking...symbolized her release from the limitations imposed by the Humans' toxin.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): By doing this, ......she could release herself from the restrictions imposed by the humans' toxin.
PC Japanese (JP): 鍵を開ける、……その行為に、自らをニンゲンの毒の制約から解き放つという意味を込めていたのだ。
Russian (RU): Так...... она могла освободиться от ограничений, налагаемых токсином {y:0:Люд}{n:0:люд}ей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Fazendo isso, ......ela poderia libertar‐se das restrições impostas pela toxina {y:0:Humana}{n:0:humana}.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 開鎖，……這個行為，乃是注入了從人類毒素的制約中解放自己的意義。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 开锁，……这个行为，乃是注入了从人类毒素的制约中解放自己的意义。

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "One day, I will—no, we will become a single witch and control all of Rokkenjima. ......When that time comes, we will gain complete freedom and will be capable of stretching our wings as we please."
Steam (ST): "One day, I will...no, we will become a single witch and rule over all of Rokkenjima. ...When that time comes, we will gain complete freedom and will be capable of stretching our wings as we please."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "One day, I will, ...no, we will become a single witch and control all of Rokkenjima. ......When that time comes, we will gain complete freedom and will be capable of stretching our wings as we please."
PC Japanese (JP): 「いつかは。妾は、うぅん、妾とそなたは一つの魔女となり、六軒島の全てを支配するだろう。……その時こそ、我らは全ての自由を得て、自在に羽を伸ばすことが出来るのだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「いつかは。妾は、うぅん、妾とそなたは一つの魔女となり、六軒島の全てを支配するだろう。……その時こそ、我らは全ての自由を得て、自在に羽を伸ばすことが出来るのだ」
Russian (RU): "Однажды я... нет, мы станем одной ведьмой и будем править всей Роккенджимой. ......Тогда мы обретём полную свободу и сможем расправить крылья как пожелаем."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Um dia, eu irei — não, nós iremos nos tornar uma única bruxa e controlar Rokkenjima. ......Quando a hora chegar, iremos obter a completa liberdade e seremos capazes de esticar nossas asas o quanto quisermos."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「總有一天。妾身，不，妾身與汝是會成為合為一體的魔女，支配六軒島的一切吧。……那時，我們將會得到所有的自由，將能自由自在地伸展羽翼。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「总有一天。妾身，不，妾身与汝是会成为合为一体的魔女，支配六轩岛的一切吧。……那时，我们将会得到所有的自由，将能自由自在地伸展羽翼。」

Umineko Project (UP): We won't have to be afraid of anyone's gaze anymore.
Steam (ST): We won't have to be afraid of anyone's gaze anymore.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): もう、誰の目に怯えることもない。
Russian (RU): Нам больше не придётся бояться чужих взглядов.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não teremos mais que temer o olhar de ninguém.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 再也不用去怕，任何人的目光了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Umineko Project (UP): We'll be able to fly wherever we wish, disappear whenever we want. Laugh however we like, prank however we like, talk with anyone we want to.
Steam (ST): We'll be able to fly wherever we wish, disappear whenever we want. Laugh however we like, prank however we like, talk with anyone we want to.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): We'll be able to fly wherever we wish, disappear whenever we want. Laugh however we like, prank however we like, talk with anyone we want to.

Russian (RU): Мы будем летать где хотим, исчезать когда захотим. Смеяться как мы любим, шутить как нам нравится, говорить с кем хотим.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Seremos capazes de voar para onde quisermos, desaparecer quando quisermos. Rir como quisermos, pregar peças o quanto quisermos, conversarmos com quem quisermos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 想飛就飛，想消失就消失。想笑就笑，想搞怪就搞怪，想和誰聊天就和誰聊天。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 想飞就飞，想消失就消失。想笑就笑，想搞怪就搞怪，想和谁聊天就和谁聊天。

Umineko Project (UP): {y:0:Human}{n:0:Human}s might ask things of us from time to time.{n}They might fight with us or play with us too.
Steam (ST): Humans might ask things of us from time to time. They might fight with us or play with us too.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Humans might ask things of us from time to time. They might fight with us or play with us too.
PC Japanese (JP): 時にはニンゲンに物を頼まれるかもしれない。時にはケンカをすることも、あるいは一緒に遊ぶこともあるかもしれない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 時にはニンゲンに物を頼まれるかもしれない。{n}時にはケンカをすることも、あるいは一緒に遊ぶこともあるかもしれない。
Russian (RU): {y:0:Люд}{n:0:люд}и смогут время от времени задавать нам вопросы.{n}Они смогут противостоять нам или же играть с нами.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De tempos em tempos, os {y:0:Humanos}{n:0:humanos} podem nos fazer pedidos.{n}Eles podem lutar contra nós ou brincar conosco também.

Umineko Project (UP): What wonderful things for us frail creatures, who cannot appear before anyone, to look forward to......
Steam (ST): What wonderful things for us frail creatures, who cannot appear before anyone, to look forward to...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): What wonderful things for us frail creatures, who cannot appear before anyone, to look forward to......
PC Japanese (JP): それら全てが、誰の前にも現れることの出来ない、脆い身である今の自分たちには、眩いくらいに楽しみなこと……。
Russian (RU): Достаточно замечательные вещи для нас, хрупких и неспособных ни перед кем появиться созданий, чтобы с нетерпением ждать их......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Para nós, frágeis criaturas que não podem aparecer diante de ninguém, são todas coisas maravilhosas na qual podemos sonhar......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這一切，對於身為無法於任何人面前出現的脆弱之身的、此刻的自己兩人來說，簡直是燦爛到耀眼的期盼……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这一切，对于身为无法于任何人面前出现的脆弱之身的、此刻的自己两人来说，简直是灿烂到耀眼的期盼……。

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "......Right now, they are little more than pranks. However, as they pile up, proof that we exist will begin to gather. The servants already call me the witch {f:5:Beatrice}, master of the night, and are beginning to believe in me bit by bit."
Steam (ST): "...Right now, they are little more than pranks. However, as they pile up, proof that we exist will begin to gather. The servants already call me the witch, {f:5:Beatrice}, master of the night, and are beginning to believe in me bit by bit."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Right now, they are little more than pranks. However, as they pile up, proof that we exist will begin to gather. The servants already call me the witch Beatrice, master of the night, and are beginning to believe in me bit by bit."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……今は、イタズラ程度に過ぎん。しかし、これの積み重ねによって、我らは存在する証を少しずつ得ていく。すでに使用人たちは、妾の存在を、夜の支配者、魔女ベアトリーチェと呼び、その存在をわずかずつだが信じ始めている。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……今は、イタズラ程度に過ぎん。しかし、これの積み重ねによって、我らは存在する証を少しずつ得ていく。すでに使用人たちは、妾の存在を、夜の支配者、魔女ベアトリーチェと呼び、その存在をわずかずつだが信じ始めている」
Russian (RU): "......Сейчас всё это не слишком отличается от шуток, однако, накапливаясь, станет доказательством нашего существования. Слуги уже называют меня ведьмой {f:5:Беатриче}, ночной госпожой, и понемногу начинают верить в меня."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Agora mesmo, não passam de brincadeiras inocentes. Porém, quando começam a se acumular, passam a ser provas de que existimos. Os serviçais já se referem a mim como a bruxa {f:5:Beatrice}, a governante da noite, e pouco a pouco estão começando a acreditar em mim."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……在此刻，這只不過是惡作劇程度的玩意。但是，通過將這些積累起來，我們會一點點地獲得自身存在的證據。傭人們已在把妾身的存在，稱為夜間的支配者——魔女貝阿朵莉切，雖是緩步漸進，但已開始相信這一存在。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……在此刻，这只不过是恶作剧程度的玩意。但是，通过将这些积累起来，我们会一点点地获得自身存在的证据。佣人们已在把妾身的存在，称为夜间的支配者——魔女贝阿朵莉切，虽是缓步渐进，但已开始相信这一存在。」

Umineko Project (UP): "The more they believe, the more those {y:0:Human}{n:0:human}s will lose their anti‐magic toxin..."
Steam (ST): "The more they believe, the more those Humans will lose their anti-magic toxin..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "The more they believe, the more those humans will lose their anti-magic toxin..."

Russian (RU): Потому что...... он без всяких сомнений, по‐настоящему верит в моё, ведьмы, существование.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E.........isso acontece porque ele verdadeiramente acredita na existência da bruxa que eu sou, ele não possui dúvidas.

Umineko Project (UP): I finally realized that, though I'd thought him to be cold, Father did possess a kindness that couldn't be seen......
Steam (ST): I finally realize that, though I thought him to be cold, Father does possess a kindness that can't be seen...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I finally realize that, though I'd thought him to be cold, Father did possess a kindness that couldn't be seen......
PC Japanese (JP): 冷たいと思っていたお父様の、目に見えぬ優しさを、ようやく私は知る……。
Russian (RU): Наконец я поняла, что, хоть я и считала его холодным, отец всё же обладает незримой добротой...

Chinese Simplified (CN): 我终于领会到了，本以为好冷漠的父亲大人的，那份眼所不能见的温柔……。

Umineko Project (UP): "I'd like to become a great witch and appear in front of everyone soon."
Steam (ST): "I'd like to become a great witch and appear in front of everyone soon."

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "Mm. Eventually, we will be able to appear openly in front of anyone. By doing that repeatedly, we will make people believe in us, ...and eventually, we shall display even our magic for all to see. ......After that happens, we will descend upon Rokkenjima as the Great Witch you told me of. Ahahahahaha!"
Steam (ST): "Indeed. Eventually, we will be able to appear openly in front of anyone. By doing that repeatedly, we shall make people believe in us even more, ...and eventually, we shall display even our magic for all to see. ...At that time, we shall descend upon Rokkenjima as the great witch you told me of. Ahahahahaha!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Yes. Eventually, we will be able to appear openly in front of anyone. By doing that repeatedly, we will make people believe in us, ...and eventually, we shall display even our magic for all to see. ......After that happens, we will descend upon Rokkenjima as the great witch you told me of. Ahahahahaha!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「うむ。やがては、誰の前にも堂々と姿を現すことが出来るだろう。それを重ね、さらに存在を信じさせ、やがては魔法さえ披露し、……我らは、そなたが話してくれた大魔女として、六軒島に君臨するのだっ。うっははははは！」
Russian (RU): "Да. В конечном итоге мы сможем открыто предстать перед кем угодно. Если делать так постоянно, люди в нас поверят, и в конце концов мы даже сможем показать всем нашу магию. ......А после мы воцаримся на Роккенджиме как та великая ведьма, о которой ты говорила. Аха‐ха‐ха‐ха!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Mm. Eventualmente, nós seremos capazes de aparecermos na frente de qualquer um. Repetindo isso diversas vezes, nós faremos as pessoas acreditarem em nós, ...e, eventualmente, nós seremos capaz até mesmo de exibir nossa magia para todos. ......Quando isso acontecer, nós iremos descender em Rokkenjima como a Grande Bruxa na qual me contaste. Ahahahahaha!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「嗯。在將來，我們是能在任何人面前光明正大地現身吧。積累努力，令他們更加地相信我等的存在，最終連魔法都給展現出來，……我們，將作為汝所講的那位大魔女，君臨六軒島。哇、哈哈哈哈哈！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「嗯。在将来，我们是能在任何人面前光明正大地现身吧。积累努力，令他们更加地相信我等的存在，最终连魔法都给展现出来，……我们，将作为汝所讲的那位大魔女，君临六轩岛。哇、哈哈哈哈哈！」

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……魔女側の理屈はなかなかに面白い。退屈せぬ」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Umineko Project (UP): "It does sound credible, in a way. When {y:0:Human}{n:0:human}s are warned that they're about to enter a famously haunted place, a hot spot for ghosts, they're likely to start yelling "ghost, ghost!" at the drop of a hat."
Steam (ST): "It does sound credible, in a way. When Humans are frightened to hear that they've entered a ghost hot-spot, they're likely to start yelling "ghost, ghost!" at the drop of a hat."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "It does sound credible, in a way. When humans are frightened to hear that they've entered a ghost hot-spot, they're likely to start yelling 'ghost, ghost!' at the drop of a hat."
PC Japanese (JP): 「信憑性って、あるわよね。ここは幽霊が出る有名な心霊スポット、って脅されたら、木の葉が一枚落ちたって、ニンゲンは幽霊が出た出たと騒ぐわ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「信憑性って、あるわよね。ここは幽霊が出る有名な心霊スポット、って脅されたら、木の葉が一枚落ちたって、ニンゲンは幽霊が出た出たと騒ぐわ」
Russian (RU): "В некотором смысле звучит правдоподобно. Слыша, что вошли в обиталище привидений, {y:0:Люд}{n:0:люд}и обычно пугаются и начинают кричать на ровном месте: 'Призрак, призрак!'."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "De certa forma, possui credibilidade. Quando {y:0:Humanos}{n:0:humanos} ficam sabendo que estão entrando uma área considerada como ponto de encontro de fantasmas, muitos já começam a gritar coisas como "fantasma, fantasma!" assim que a primeira folha cai de uma árvore."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「可信性，是有的。畢竟，只要被嚇唬說這裡是有幽靈出現的、有名鬧鬼地點，掉下一片樹葉，人類都會大吵“幽靈出來了幽靈出來了”。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「可信性，是有的。毕竟，只要被吓唬说这里是有幽灵出现的、有名闹鬼地点，掉下一片树叶，人类都会大吵“幽灵出来了幽灵出来了”。」

Speaker: {f:5:Featherine}
Umineko Project (UP): "That's right. All phenomena are fundamentally neutral, indifferent, and dull. ......If one wishes to have them be accepted in a certain manner, they must first create a suitable environment..."
Steam (ST): "That's right. At a fundamental level, all phenomena are neutral, indifferent, and dull. ...If you want them be viewed in a certain way, you must first create a suitable environment..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「そうだ。全ての現象は本来、中立、中性、無味無色だ。……それを、望む受け取り方をさせるには、その環境作りが必要となる…。」

Umineko Project (UP): "Hidden devices and tricks are in violation of Knox's third {f:5:commandment}. However, if and only if foreshadowing has been presented, these are permitted by Knox's eighth {f:5:commandment}."

Umineko Project (UP): Knox's third commandment prohibits hidden doors and devices that have no clues pointing towards them.
Steam (ST): Knox's 3rd prohibits hidden doors and devices that have no clues pointing towards them.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Knox's 3rd prohibits hidden doors and devices that have no clues pointing towards them.

Umineko Project (UP): Witch illusions are an attempt to make others acknowledge the existence of magic by claiming that something would be impossible without it. That is the attack used by witches.
Steam (ST): An "Illusion of the Witch" occurs when someone tries to force the acknowledgement of magic by claiming that a thing would be impossible without it. It's how witches launch an attack.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The Illusion of the Witch is created by making the existence of magic be acknowledged by claiming that it would be impossible without magic. That is the attack used by witches.
PC Japanese (JP): 魔法以外では不可能だと主張することにより、魔法の存在を認めさせようとするのが、魔女幻想。魔女の攻撃。
Russian (RU): Иллюзия ведьмы создаётся, когда магию признают, утверждая, что случай без неё невозможен. Так атакуют ведьмы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ilusões da bruxa são uma tentativa de fazer com que os demais reconheçam sua existência alegando que presenciaram algo que deveria ser impossível. Esta é a forma de ataque utilizada pelas bruxas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 通過主張除魔法外辦不到，從而令人承認魔法的存在的是，魔女幻想。魔女的攻擊。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 通过主张除魔法外办不到，从而令人承认魔法的存在的是，魔女幻想。魔女的攻击。

Umineko Project (UP): If someone can argue back and say that it would be possible without magic, the witch illusion is defeated, and the witch must retreat.
Steam (ST): If someone's able to successfully argue back and show that it would be possible without magic, the Illusion of the Witch is defeated, and the witch must retreat.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If someone can argue back and say that it would be possible without magic, the Illusion of the Witch is defeated, and the witch must retreat.
PC Japanese (JP): それを、魔法以外でも可能だと反論できれば、魔女幻想は打ち破られ、魔女は退けられる。
Russian (RU): Если кто‐то в ответ доказывает, что произошедшее возможно без магии, иллюзия ведьмы разрушается, и ведьме приходится отступить.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se alguém for capaz de argumentar contra e dizer que seria possível sem magia, a ilusão da bruxa é desfeita, e a bruxa deve se retratar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而只要能講出除魔女外也做得到地做出反駁，魔女幻想即是會被攻破，魔女即是會被擊退。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而只要能讲出除魔女外也做得到地做出反驳，魔女幻想即是会被攻破，魔女即是会被击退。

Umineko Project (UP): The magic that Maria claimed to have seen had the possibility of being a trick, so it was unqualified to be acknowledged as magic.
Steam (ST): The magic Maria claimed to have seen could have been a trick, so it was unqualified to be acknowledged as magic.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The magic that Maria claimed to have seen had the possibility of being a trick, so it was unqualified to be acknowledged as magic.
PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞が見たと主張する魔法は、手品だった可能性があり、魔法だと認めるに足らない。
Russian (RU): Магия, о которой заявила Мария, могла быть трюком, и поэтому её нельзя было признать магией.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A magia que Maria alegou ter visto possivelmente não passou de um truque, por isso não é qualificada para ser reconhecida como magia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 真里亞主張看到過的魔法，存在著是變戲法的可能性，不足以令人承認魔法。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 真里亚主张看到过的魔法，存在着是变戏法的可能性，不足以令人承认魔法。

Original Witch Hunt (OG): That was only the result of this battle. It was still too early to bring the fight into the domain of denying Beatrice, the witch and the magic that Maria believed in......

PC Japanese (JP): ヱリカは、一気に畳み掛けて、真里亞の信じる魔女と魔法を穢すことで、情けのカケラもなく、ぶっ潰すつもりでいた…。
